title: Export Shiny Applications as Desktop Applications using Electron
text: R package allows convert Shiny web applications standalone desktop applications using Electron. means users can run Shiny apps without R installed machines.

title: Export Shiny Applications as Desktop Applications using Electron
text: can install development version shinyelectron GitHub :
code: # From CRAN (not available yet) # install.packages("shinyelectron")  # From GitHub # install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("coatless-rpkg/shinyelectron")

title: Export Shiny Applications as Desktop Applications using Electron
text: [!IMPORTANT] currently working making installation process smooth possible. Please bear us work identifying necessary dependencies platform. R (>= 4.4.0) Node.js (>= 22.0.0) npm (>= 11.5.0) building platform-specific installers: Windows: Windows 11+ Visual Studio Build Tools macOS: macOS 10.13+ Xcode CLI Linux: Appropriate development tools distribution

title: Export Shiny Applications as Desktop Applications using Electron
text: export() function allows convert Shiny application standalone Electron application. example, convert “Hello World” Shiny app shiny package standalone Electron app:
code: library(shinyelectron)  # Export a Shiny application to an Electron application shinyelectron::export(   appdir = "path/to/your/shinyapp",   destdir = "path/to/export/destination" ) # Copy "Hello World" from `{shiny}` system.file("examples", "01_hello", package="shiny") |>     fs::dir_copy("myapp", overwrite = TRUE)  shinyelectron::export("myapp", "hello-world-app")

title: Export Shiny Applications as Desktop Applications using Electron
text: can customize export process using following options:
code: shinyelectron::export(   appdir = "path/to/your/shinyapp",   destdir = "path/to/export/destination",   app_name = "My Amazing App",   platform = c("win", "mac"),  # Build for Windows and Mac only   include_r = TRUE,    # Bundle minimal R environment   r_version = "4.4.3", # Bundle R 4.4.3   overwrite = TRUE,    # Overwrite existing files in destdir   verbose = TRUE,      # Display detailed progress information    open_after = TRUE    # Open the generated project after export )
